title: 'datalad save' rename error on win10 ubuntu 20.04 app
body:
#### What is the problem?

```datalad save``` gave rename error about permission as regular user

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

```$ sudo apt install datalad -yq
$ datalad create -c text2git pdfs
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at ./pdfs
[INFO   ]   Detected a filesystem without fifo support.
[INFO   ]   Disabling ssh connection caching.
[INFO   ] Running procedure cfg_text2git
[INFO   ] == Command start (output follows) =====
[INFO   ] == Command exit (modification check follows) =====
create(ok): ./pdfs (dataset)
$ cd pdfs
$ mv $path/*.pdf .
$ datalad status
untracked: datalad.pdf (file)
$ datalad save -m 'example'
[ERROR  ] git-annex: .git/annex/othertmp/datalad.pdf.0/datalad.pdf: rename: permission denied (Permission denied) [add(./datalad.pdf)]
add(error): datalad.pdf (file) [git-annex: .git/annex/othertmp/datalad.pdf.0/datalad.pdf: rename: permission denied (Permission denied)]
action summary: 
add (error: 1)
save (notneeded: 1)
```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

0.12.4

<details>
<summary>Full WTF</summary> 

```shell

  - version: 0.12.4
```
